title: A short trip to Vellore
text:
18, 2015 
Vellore one of the known place in India is also a famous tourist destination. The city also houses one of the best hospitals in India. Rich in culture and tradition, the city welcomes every sort of visitors. Read on for more information. 

Vellore, the historical city of South India is a very popular tourist destination. You can hire a bicycle and explore the city, ride to the remotest place and enjoy the essence of the place. This picturesque city is situated on the banks of the Palara River, Vellore is one of the oldest cities of South India and has been ruled by different dynasties at a different point of history. Well known for Institute of Technology and the Christian Medical College and Hospital, the city witness a large number of people for the different purpose. Rich with historical and religious attractions Vellore is a good place for an ideal holiday. Take your family or friend, it is a great place for a historical excursion. The warm hospitality of the city is about to surprise you. Vellore is enriched with every necessary amenity and being a tourist you will love the environment. There are a large number of hotels in Vellore which provides a comfortable stay to its guests. 
Vellore is among the must-visit places of India. The city is very well-connected with other parts of the state as well as the rest of the country. Tirupati Airport is 93 km, Chennai Airport is 119 km and Bangalore Airport is 200 km away. All these airports are well-linked with other major cities of India and you can accordingly choose where to land. Taxis, buses and cabs are readily available outside the airport to take you to Vellore. Vellore has its own railway station and it is one of the best modes to reach the city. Regular passenger and superfast trains connect the Vellore Cantt station. 
When you are in Vellore, the Vellore Fort is the first place in your itinerary. One of the oldest forts of India, Vellore fort depicts the royalty and history of the place. Once a politically important structure is now among the popular tourists attractions of South India. The city also houses the 150 years old Church of South India. The clock tower which was built in the memory of English soldier who lost their lives in World War I. The Pearl Palace and Government Museum are also popular places to visit. Most of the travellers prefer to travel to Vellore in the same trip with Chennai. And you cannot skip the very famous Tirupati temple. The temple on the top of Tirumala Hill is a treat to the devotees and the visitors. One of the holiest and grand temple of South India, the temple is widely visited by tourists every year. 
Vellore is the perfect blend of tradition and ethnicity. Reflecting the early Dravidian civilization, it is one of the tourist hotspots. The best time to visit the city is from October to March. You can choose from the list of budget hotels in Vellore. All the hotels provide both fooding and lodging, even most of them offers a pick and drop service if you book the room before reaching the place.
